original_title: Sri Lanka stocks hit new high
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Monday, data on its site showed.
The broader ASPI closed up 2.08 percent, or 295.10 points, at 14,500; while the more liquid S&P SL20 Index closed up 2.48 percent, or 105.37 points, at 4,349.

Top turnover generators were Ceylinco Holdings (up at 3,045.75), John Keells Holdings (up at 21.70), Sampath Bank (up at 108.75), Hatton National Bank (up at 274.00), and Pan Asia Banking Corporation.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI included Commercial Bank (up at 134.25), and LOLC Holdings (up at 553.25).
Banking stocks fared well after the ISB announcement on Friday.

Crossings were recorded on Ceylinco Holdings, JKH, C W Mackie (up at 101.50), Aiken Spence (up at 137.25), Sampath Bank, PABC, Sunshine Holdings (down at 87.00), People’s Leasing and Finance (up at 15.00), Hayleys (up at 118.75), Capital Alliance (up at 52.80), Seylan Bank (up at 69.40), Lanka IOC (up at 120.25), Melstacorp (up at 113.00), CIC Holdings (up at 83.20), L B Finance (down at 83.50), and Commercial Bank.
Foreign buying was seen in Aitken Spence, JKH, LIOC, HNB, Commercial Bank, and Lanka Milk Foods (down at 38.00).
Foreign selling was seen in Sunshine Holdings, Seylan Bank, Sampath Bank, Melstacorp, Ceylon Grain Elevators (up at 180.00) and CIC non-voting (up at 62.40). (Colombo/Dec16/2024)
